intro: Tritonia chrysantha, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are erect and can reach up to 30 centimeters in height. Tritonia chrysantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to care for.
